title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description:
An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. A 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer. In the 'defaultValue' field, an invalid date string '55/66/9999' is entered. However, the invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design: 
<parameters>
<scalarparameter name='dateParam1'>
<property name='dataType'>dateTime</property>
<property name='allowBlank'>false</property>
<property name='format'>Unformatted</property>
<property name='controlType'>textbox</property>
<expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression>
</scalarparameter>
</parameters>
There are two problems here: 
(1) The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale independent, to ensure portability.
OB: The invalid 'dateParam1' parameter value '55/66/9999' is accepted and stored in the report definition as the default value.
EB: The invalid 'dateParam1' parameter value '55/66/9999' should be rejected and an error message should be displayed indicating that the entered date/time is invalid.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter and set its 'dataType' to 'DateTime'.
3. Enter an invalid date/time string, such as '55/66/9999', in the 'defaultValue' field of the parameter.
4. Save the report and observe if the invalid value is accepted without any error message.
